metadata.title: Indexing arbitrary-length k-mers in sequencing reads
metadata.abstract: © 2015 Kowalski et al.We propose a lightweight data structure for indexing and querying collections of NGS reads data in main memory. The data structure supports the interface proposed in the pioneering work by Philippe et al. for counting and locating k-mers in sequencing reads. Our solution, PgSA (pseudogenome suffix array), based on finding overlapping reads, is competitive to the existing algorithms in the space use, query times, or both. The main applications of our index include variant calling, error correction and analysis of reads from RNA-seq experiments. Copyright:

description: Compact index for collections of reads from sequencing. It allows to ask for presence of k-mers in the reads.
name: PgSA
